abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objective of the Essential
            Drugs Project is to support Nigeria's plans, under its
            new national essential drugs policy, to ensure that the
            public, particularly low-income groups, has access to a
            sustainable supply of safe, effective and affordable drugs.
            Due to significant demand, limited budgetary resources and
            high prices, most public health facilities have had little
            or no drugs in recent years. The project entails four main
            strategies which correspond to those of the national policy
            and address the major issues in the subsector. The
            strategies involve: (a) developing an affordable and
            sustainable supply of safe drugs, (b) improving the skills
            of health workers in providing drugs, (c) changing the
            harmful practices of beneficiaries, and (d) strengthening
            institutional capacities to undertake essential drugs
            programs (EDPs).
